intro: Trianthema pakistanense, commonly known as the Pakistan daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky soils or along dry riverbeds. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
